thread.title: Bibiani assembly unable to break deadlock over Presiding Member
thread.title_full: Bibiani assembly unable to break deadlock over Presiding Member

title: Bibiani assembly unable to break deadlock over Presiding Member
text:
17:00 CET Bibiani assembly unable to break deadlock over Presiding Member By GNA 
Bibiani (W/R), Oct. 08, GNA - The Bibiani-Ahwiaso-Bekwai District Assembly's attempt to elect its Presiding Member (PM) ended in a stalemate as none of those who filed their nomination to run for the position could garner the required two-thirds majority backing. 
The election, a straight battle between Mr. Thomas Nsiah and Mr. Anane Manu saw the former receiving 27 votes with the latter getting 24 votes during the first round of voting. 
This forced the assembly to hold another round of voting to try and break the deadlock but that was also inconclusive. 
This time round the pair bagged equal number of votes - each secured 26 votes. 
At that point, the assembly decided to postpone the election to a later date. GNA
